body_html:
The OS is Ubuntu 16.04 for IBM POWER (ppc64le). The cuDNN .deb packages are:

libcudnn5_5.1.5-1+cuda8.0_ppc64el.deb
libcudnn5-dev_5.1.5-1+cuda8.0_ppc64el.deb
libcudnn5-doc_5.1.5-1+cuda8.0_ppc64el.deb

The redirect with those packages doesn't involve /usr/local/cuda* at all:

/usr/include/cudnn.h -> /etc/alternatives/libcudnn -> /usr/include/powerpc64le-linux-gnu/cudnn_v5.h

And update-alternatives offers no other option.

The redirect with those packages doesn't involve /usr/local/cuda* at all:
/usr/include/cudnn.h -> /etc/alternatives/libcudnn -> /usr/include/powerpc64le-linux-gnu/cudnn_v5.h
And update-alternatives offers no other option.
body:
The OS is Ubuntu 16.04 for IBM POWER (ppc64le).  The cuDNN .deb packages are:

libcudnn5_5.1.5-1+cuda8.0_ppc64el.deb
libcudnn5-dev_5.1.5-1+cuda8.0_ppc64el.deb
libcudnn5-doc_5.1.5-1+cuda8.0_ppc64el.deb

The redirect with those packages doesn't involve /usr/local/cuda* at all:

/usr/include/cudnn.h -> /etc/alternatives/libcudnn -> /usr/include/powerpc64le-linux-gnu/cudnn_v5.h

And update-alternatives offers no other option.
